meanings.sent1: During the party, I will regale my friends with funny stories.
meanings.sent2: She loves to regale her guests with tales of her travels.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to regale the audience with jokes, but they didn't find them funny.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling skills can regale even the most skeptical listeners.
meanings.sent5: The children gathered around the campfire, eager to be regaled with ghost stories.

meanings.definition: Provide with choice or abundant food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant will regale us with a delicious feast tonight.
meanings.sent2: The wedding reception will regale the guests with a variety of dishes.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to regale the diners with a surprise dessert.
meanings.sent4: The buffet table was regaled with an array of delectable treats.
meanings.sent5: The picnic spread was regaled with fresh fruits and sandwiches.

meanings.sent3: The teacher tried to regale the students with a boring lecture, but they fell asleep.

meanings.sent5: The storyteller's voice had the power to regale even the most disinterested audience.
